summary: Internal email correspondence within the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York discussing whether to include photos of Ghislaine Maxwell and Jeffrey Epstein, as well as locations of abuse, in the indictment against Maxwell for use at a press conference.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Referred to as 'GM' and the subject of the indictment being discussed; the email mentions using an iconic photo of her with Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned in the context of a past press conference where his photo was used, and referenced in the 'iconic' photo with Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Chief, Criminal Division
persons.context: The sender of the initial email proposing to include photos in the indictment; a senior official in the U.S. Attorney's Office, SDNY.

connections.description: Referenced together in an 'iconic' photo; the indictment against Maxwell is related to Epstein's activities.

events.title: Discussion of GM Indictment Visuals
events.description: Internal email discussion within the U.S. Attorney's Office about including photos of Ghislaine Maxwell and Jeffrey Epstein, and abuse locations, in the indictment for use at a press conference.

keyFacts: Prosecutors considered including photos of Ghislaine Maxwell and Jeffrey Epstein in the indictment for visual impact at a press conference.
The email references an 'iconic' photo of Maxwell and Epstein together that was widely publicly available.
Prosecutors referenced using a photo of Epstein at a prior press conference without it being in the indictment as a precedent.
The discussion indicates strategic planning by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the public rollout of the indictment against Maxwell.
